questions.question: [TEST] Hello World123 [TEST]
Does your organization provide VPN and Office Laptops for work from home to ensure safer transfer of work information?
Does the company require employees to secure their home wifi to avoid breaches?
Does the company limit access of company information to the relevant departments/employees to ensure minimal data leakage?
Do you have specific training on cybersecurity for employees?
Is there encryption on company data for security? Both in servers and in-transit to prevent breaches and interceptions?
Do you have network segregation in your company to maintain security in important internal networks?
Does your company have any monitoring in place for suspicious activities on the company servers/networks to minimize response time to cyber attacks?
Does your company change the password (Wifi network, employee password) over a period of time regularly to help reduce intruders?
To prevent exposure of company data to unprotected networks, does the company ban the use of public wifi or devices that are used to access company data?
Is your company aware that breaches can be conducted through IoT (Internet of Things, meaning any device such as smart fridge, thermometer, microwave, etc that are connected to the internet)?
Do your employees know never to give sensitive information to supervisors via unsecured channels?
Does your company have a response plan in case of a cybercrime incident?
Does your organization monitor the access to intellectual property in order to prevent unauthorized staff from accessing IP?
Does your company have a real-time incident response system in place to monitor any suspicious behavior on company servers and cloud storage that contains sensitive data?
The malware attacks can be made from an email attachment or file-sharing. If the cyber attacks occur, does the company have a malware removal plan for the incident?
